block.p: Believers in the biblical injunction against building houses on sand found an ally in the Federal Emergency Management Agency, which published an analysis of shoreline building with an alarming conclusion: a quarter of the houses within 500 feet of the coasts on the ocean and Great Lakes are in danger of falling to the waves in the next 60 years.

Believers in the biblical injunction against building houses on sand found an ally in the Federal Emergency Management Agency, which published an analysis of shoreline building with an alarming conclusion: a quarter of the houses within 500 feet of the coasts on the ocean and Great Lakes are in danger of falling to the waves in the next 60 years.

The report says Fema must alter the federal Flood Insurance Program to reflect this risk -- principally by mapping erosion hazard areas and raising insurance rates there. But advocates for coastal dwellers called the report a thinly disguised attempt to drive residents from the beach.
